titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should negotiate with the Government of Vietnam to establish interest sections in the capitals of both countries for the purpose of resolving specific issues between the countries.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Operations.
Referred to Subcommittee on Asian and Pacific Affairs.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received From State.

bill.summary: 3/23/1988--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should negotiate an agreement with the Government of Vietnam to establish interest sections in the capitals of both countries to resolve specific issues between the countries.
